intro: Linum strictum var. paniculatum, commonly known as the panicled flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences, which are characteristic of its common name. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and covered in fine hairs. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in fiber production.
